Data.Description: Limited time ore found in Void. (Obtainable until 13 March, 12 AM UTC)

Data.Message: A soothing presence permeates the air in a shroud of mystifying mist...

Data.Description: Bromine, typically found in liquid form, is a toxic chemical element. Why is it solid here?

Data.Message: A soothing presence permeates the air in a shroud of purple mist...
You feel your body float in the air as all the light around you blends into millions of stars...

Data.Description: The coldest ore (and thing in general) that can be found on earth. Touching one of these will cause your entire body to develop frostbite within 15 minutes. Thankfully, the Inclemetite Vaccine miners receive before beginning their journey protects them from this entirely.
Data.Message: The air thins out as frost begins to accumulate on every inch of your body...
Divine forces emanate from a heavenly cave...

Data.Description: Structurally similar to Olivine, Maricite is also a part of the phosphate mineral group.

Data.Message: You feel your body corrupt in the air as all light around you gets lamentable...

Data.Description: Missed opportunity to be called Rexolite :(
Wow, I could make a gyroscope with this!
this is what happens when you divide by 0
A great alternative to garnet... and ruby? What are they making me say?
Fool's gold. Don't be tricked. Why is gold more common here? I thought it was the other way around. Huh.
A yellow form of Beryl, commonly used in luxury jewels.
A sooty black mineral, found very commonly throughout Natura and its Moon, used in explosives because of its combustibility as well as a darkening agent for more evil tools.
Not to be confused with a musician of similar name

Data.Message: Polychromatic lights fly all around you as you slowly lose control...
Fiction takes hold of reality...
money enjoyer...

Data.Description: An iridescent cube which changes color in the vibrance.
What's the point of an hourglass if it doesn't tell you the time? Who made this thing?
Data.Message: Time comes to a standstill...
Deep in festive depths, an ephemeral celebration of color shines merrily...

Data.Description: The primary component of alkaline batteries.
A stiff and sticky substance of earth often used in pottery, brick making, ceramics, and art once dried.
You shoot me down, but I won't fall...
Although by itself copper is relatively weak, it is commonly alloyed with other materials for color or durability.
what about this ore has anything to do with the amazon

Data.Message: An unusual force materializes upon the surface of this world...

Data.Description: Limited time ore found in Darkmatter (Obtainable until 25 March, 12 AM UTC).
It has a misleading name; this can't be found in the sea.. nor is it aquatic at all. Sorry.

Data.Message: Be warned, haos_terry, for your time has come.

Tick, tock, tick, tock, tick, tock, tick, tock, tick, tock, tick, tock, tick, tock, tick, tock.

Data.Message: A forgotten entity buried in the center of the earth in an age long past gains hope as you draw closer...

Data.Description: A bright green mineral found only in the most natural of places.. like the MOON'S CORE! And Granite, I suppose.

Data.Message: You feel your body inflate in the air as all light around you gains chromatic colors...

A strange, shape-shifting dyson sphere made entirely from gold.

Extremely red and durable, rubies are used as ornaments or reinforcements on tools.

A long-time, highly sought after material. It is typically used to make hats or clothing, but can be used to make equipment.

Data.Description: The gray ore that smiles back.
Radioactive and turquoise; you lose all sense of touch when you interact.

Data.Description: Only found in ice caves. A freezing, snowy ore. People rich enough to buy some of this use it as... everlasting icecubes.

Data.Message: A solitude seed of ice sprouts from the frost, its petals wrapping around the ground beneath it...

Not to be mistaken for Chlorophyll.
very bright star that has been toned down in order to not replicate the horrors of Golden
A burning shard that broke off of an O-type star, likely a blue giant.

Only found in caves without a type in a randomized unexposed 50 meter range.

A burning shard that broke off of an M-type star, likely a red dwarf.
A milestone marking the "end" of your journey through the Thermal Collapse. Have fun with the 3 extraction boosts!
The permafrost is known for its high concentration of copper, in the form of various oxides and minerals. Chrysocolla is one of those many forms.
A bright ball of energy created by an intense magnetic attraction.

Data.Message: An indefinite number of hallucinations reaves your mind...

Data.Description: Often used in good luck amulets for their natural green energy.
A flaky ore with sections falling apart, revealing a brightly colored core.

Data.Message: A perfect geometrical structure weaves around you...

Data.Description: Usually used in plates due to its high ductility and also energy density for electric tools.
A wavy pink gemstone used in making similarly pink glass.
A hypnotic, otherworldly ore made of the aspirations and unfulfilled ambitions of miners past.
[WINTER 2022 EXCLUSIVE] Only found in the frost layer when it overrides the Core and Granite layers.
A well-known metal. Although mostly used cosmetically, it is still useful in some ways.
A ball surging with a strange, electricity-like energy.

Data.Message: A distant beacon of light shines through the cold, blistering haze...

A dark ore found in the dark, making it hard to spot.

Data.Message: You feel your body aberrate in the air as all light around you distorts its color...

Data.Description: A gargantuan metal from deep underground. It is very strong and reacts to other elements oddly.

Data.Message: A burst of seraphic energy surges through your soul...
